definition: to have an audience with
to move forward/to promote/to advance
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: He had come from Gascony and was going to Paris to see the King.
sentences.chinese: 达德尼昂来自加斯科尼，正前往巴黎晋见国王。

sentences.english: One day when I was talking with the emperor, a messenger came to him.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，当我和皇帝交谈时，有位信差来晋见。

sentences.english: I'll never forget meeting the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会忘记晋见女王的情景。

sentences.english: So, he took Chuang Tzu to court for audience with King Wen of Zhao.
sentences.chinese: 就带着庄子上殿，晋见赵文王去了。

sentences.english: Each general was asked to come to see them one by one.
sentences.chinese: 每位将领被要求逐一晋见。

sentences.english: A cat may look on the king.
sentences.chinese: 相比看智者猫也有权晋见国王。

definition: to have an audience (with the Emperor)
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
special envoy/special ambassador
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
to discuss official business
to receive sb/to grant an interview
to greet/to go out to meet
to go abroad as ambassador/to be sent on a diplomatic mission
(diplomatic) envoy
a diplomatic group/a delegation
to receive orders
secret envoy
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
